document.docTitle: Predatoroonops mctiernani Brescovit, Rheims, and Santos 2012, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The Brazilian Goblin Spiders Of The New Genus Predatoroonops (Araneae: Oonopidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Brazilian Goblin Spiders Of The New Genus Predatoroonops (Araneae: Oonopidae)
Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History

subSubSection.paragraph:
Predatoroonops mctiernani Brescovit, Rheims, and Santos
, new species

TYPES: Male holotype and female paratype from Fazenda Santa Helena , 22 ° 349S, 44 ° 219W, Pinheiral, Rio de Janeiro , Brazil ( Nov. 5–11, 1999 , A.D. Brescovit et al.), deposited in IBSP 66861 (PBI_ OON 10919 ) and IBSP 66875 (PBI_ OON 10920 ), respectively.
ETYMOLOGY: The specific name is a patronym in honor of John McTiernan, the director of the first movie in the ‘‘Predator’’ series.

DIAGNOSIS: Males of
Predatoroonops mctiernani
differ from those of the remaining species by the subdistal apophysis short and distal apophysis with three branches on chelicerae (figs. 27, 403–405). Females can be easily distinguished from those of the remaining species by the epigynum with fused anterior and posterior receptacula, apodema process with curved extremities (figs. 397–398).

caption.paragraph:
Map 4. Distribution of four new
Predatoroonops
species in southeastern and eastern Brazil:

Predatoroonops mctiernani , P. maceliot , P. vallarta , and P. poncho
.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: Known from the states of Rio de Janeiro , São Paulo , and Santa Catarina , Brazil (map 4).
